summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons Program Statement (P6541.02) establishing procedures for inmate access to Over-the-Counter (OTC) medications. It details how inmates can purchase medications through the commissary or receive them for free if indigent (defined as having less than $6 in their trust fund for 30 days). The document is a general policy manual and contains no specific information about Jeffrey Epstein, his case, or any individuals involved with him.
keyFacts: This is a generic Bureau of Prisons policy document (Program Statement P6541.02) dated November 17, 2004.
The policy governs inmate access to Over-the-Counter (OTC) medications, allowing purchase via commissary or free provision for indigent inmates.
An 'inmate without funds' (indigent) is defined as one who has not had a trust fund account balance of $6.00 for the past 30 days.
The document rescinds a prior version of the policy (P6541.01) from September 10, 2003.
The document contains no references to Jeffrey Epstein, his associates, victims, or any events related to his case.
